description: China is preparing a United Nations General Assembly resolution that it says is intended to help close gaps between rich and developing countries in the advance of artificial intelligence, an initiative that follows an extensive and ambitious campaign by the US, its biggest AI competitor.
title: China Prepares UN Resolution to Tap AI for Good

description: President Joe Biden is courting actors and business leaders in Westchester County, New York, as his reelection campaign seeks to pad its cash advantage over Donald Trump for the November election.
title: Actor Michael Douglas Helps Raise Cash for Biden

description: Mexican ruling party presidential candidate Claudia Sheinbaum saw her lead over main opposition contender Xochitl Galvez narrow to 15 percentage points from 19 percentage points previously, according to an April poll.
title: Mexico’s Sheinbaum Lead Narrows to 15 Points, Poll Says

description: Former President Donald Trump’s economic advisers are considering ways to actively stop nations from shifting away from using the dollar — an effort to counter budding moves among key emerging markets to reduce exposure to the US currency, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Advisers Discuss Penalties for Nations That Move Away From the Dollar

description: Yemen Houthi rebels said they attacked an Israeli ship in the Gulf of Aden, and southern Israel.
title: Yemen’s Houthi Rebels Say They Attacked Israel and Israeli Ship

description: Foreign states are using UK universities to “steal advantage” by covertly acquiring British intellectual property, the government warned, saying it would explore proposals to protect cutting-edge research and technology.
title: UK Warns Universities About Research Threat From Foreign States

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, legal affairs correspondent Emily Birnbaum looks at the arguments at the Supreme Court on Donald Trump’s immunity claim. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: No Quick or Easy Answers From Court on Trump’s Immunity Claim

description: Rahm Emanuel, the outspoken former White House chief of staff, has redefined the role as Washington’s envoy to Tokyo — by amplifying Japan’s message and browbeating Beijing.
title: Japan's Unlikeliest Cheerleader Is an American Ambassador

description: Australia and the UK don’t yet meet arms export standards required for the Aukus partnership, the US said, in a sign that the landmark cooperation agreement may be in for delays.
title: US Says Australia, UK Don’t Yet Meet Pacific Accord Requirements

description: The US Supreme Court suggested it might drag out Donald Trump’s claim of immunity from prosecution, an outcome that could doom any chance of a pre-election trial on charges of trying to stay in power illegally.
title: Wary Supreme Court Could Extend Trump’s Immunity Bid Past November

description: A new “sin tax” is splitting Brazil’s alcoholic beverage industry as beer producers and liquor manufacturers wrangle over how much they should have to pay.
title: Beer and Booze Battle Over Rates as Brazil Wraps Up Tax Overhaul

description: Chile President Gabriel Boric said that he’s set on overhauling the nation’s political system as many of his marquee economic proposals remain bogged down in Congress.
title: Chile President Gabriel Boric Tells Investors He Wants Political System Reform

description: President Joe Biden and Donald Trump will be mere miles apart from each other this week in Manhattan, but the backdrops couldn’t be more stark: the presumptive Republican nominee sitting in a dingy courtroom and the current commander-in-chief attending fundraisers with New York City’s elite.
title: Presidents Crisscrossing New York Create a Stark Split-Screen

description: US regulators reinstated net neutrality rules that aim to ensure everything on the internet is equally accessible, reclaiming authority over broadband service and setting the stage for legal challenges.
title: US Revives Net Neutrality to Establish Authority Over Internet

description: Saudi Arabia plans to host a meeting on Monday to discuss Gaza’s future with foreign officials including US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Saudi Arabia to Host Gaza Talks Next Week With Top US, UK and Arab Officials

description: The former National Enquirer publisher, David Pecker, said he spoke to Donald Trump during the 2016 presidential campaign before agreeing to buy and bury a former Playboy Playmate’s story about having an extramarital affair with Trump.
title: Tabloid Publisher Says He Spoke to Trump Before Buying Model’s Story

description: Haiti’s nine-member governing council began to take control of the troubled, gang-riven Caribbean nation after Prime Minister Ariel Henry officially resigned.
title: Haiti’s Governing Council Takes Charge in Bid to Rein In Chaos

description: The US sanctioned more than a dozen Iranian ships, people and companies linked to the country’s drone program, the latest in a push to punish Tehran over its April 13 attack on Israel and support for proxy militant groups in the Middle East.
title: US Sanctions Iran-Linked Ships, Firms, People Over Drone Program

description: Israel is stepping up preparations for a potential all-out war with Hezbollah, as the risk of a devastating new phase in the country’s conflict with Iran and its proxy militias grows more acute.
title: Israel Prepares Forces as Conflict With Hezbollah Intensifies

description: The US Supreme Court in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, Jan. 5, 2024. Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to overturn a ruling that would bar him from the presidential ballot in Colorado, setting up a historic showdown over whether his role in the Jan. 6, 2021 assault on the Capitol disqualifies him from office.
title: US Supreme Court Hears Arguments on Trump’s Immunity Claim

description: Democratic Republic of Congo’s government is hemorrhaging money as it tries to fight a series of conflicts in its eastern provinces that have displaced more than six million people, Finance Minister Nicolas Kazadi said.
title: Congo Spending a Quarter of Revenue on Security, Minister Says

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Sunak's Sick Note: Is WFH on the way out?

description: Poland’s defense chief said the country is prepared to assist Ukraine in getting fighting-age men to return to the war-battered country after Kyiv tightened conscription rules.
title: Poland Ready to Help Ukraine Return Conscription-Age Men Home

description: The US and 17 other nations pressed Hamas to release their citizens who are missing or held hostage in the Gaza Strip, in a bid to revive cease-fire talks that have stalled out in recent weeks and unlock more humanitarian aid.
title: US, Allies Press Hamas for ‘Immediate Release’ of Hostages

description: The US Supreme Court in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, Jan. 5, 2024. Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to overturn a ruling that would bar him from the presidential ballot in Colorado, setting up a historic showdown over whether his role in the Jan. 6, 2021 assault on the Capitol disqualifies him from office.
title: US Supreme Court Hears Arguments on Trump’s Immunity Claim

description: Ukraine’s finance chief said a $61 billion US aid package helps cover budget gaps for this year, though the nation’s fiscal outlook for 2025 is “very uncertain” given the duration of the war with Russia.
title: Ukraine’s Budget ‘Very Uncertain’ Next Year, Finance Chief Says

description: An audit of Zambia’s public debt found inflated costs and wasteful spending, including the government’s purchase of vastly overpriced computers and laptops for public schools that have no electricity.
title: Zambia Debt Audit Shows Government Paid 600% Premium for Laptops

description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said he’ll move ahead with a cabinet overhaul next month as he seeks to build his party’s position ahead of European Parliament elections.
title: Tusk Says He’ll Overhaul Cabinet Next Month Ahead of EU Election

description: Donald Trump said he believes he has a chance of winning New York in the Electoral College in November, a longtime goal of the presumptive GOP nominee that has eluded Republicans for 40 years.
title: Trump Says He Has ‘Good Chance’ of Winning New York in November

description: Merck KGaA became the latest pharma company to begin construction of a new center in Germany, boosting Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s push to turn the country into Europe’s leader in life sciences.
title: Scholz Gets Another Pharma Boost With New Merck KGaA Site

description: Zimbabwe’s gold-backed currency the ZiG weakened for the first time since its debut earlier this month.
title: Zimbabwe’s Gold-Backed ZiG Weakens for First Time Since Debut

description: Emmanuel Macron, France's president, during a news conference following a Special European Council summit in Brussels, Belgium, on Thursday, April 18, 2024. The European Union’s waning clout versus major geopolitical rivals is sounding alarm bells in Europe’s capitals, compelling leaders to discuss a radical transformation to boost the bloc’s competitiveness in a hostile world. Photographer: Simon Wohlfahrt/Bloomberg
title: Macron Says Inflation Cannot Be Sole Target of Monetary Policy

description: It’s independents, a growing voting bloc, who drive election victories in the swing state, where the GOP is rushing to defuse abortion as an issue.
title: Arizona’s Abortion Law Repeal Comes as Independents Trust Biden More on Issue

description: Pedro Sanchez’s decision to take several days to think about his future as Spain’s prime minister has left the euro-zone’s fourth-largest economy shrouded in political uncertainty.
title: Spain’s Sanchez Threatens to Quit. What Are His Options?

description: On this week’s Merryn Talks Money, BlondeMoney CEO Helen Thomas explains her predictions for a new prime minister and a surprise summer election.
title: Why Sunak May Quit Ahead of a July Election

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Mangaluru to Test Development Versus Hindutva Split: India Votes

description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s controversial plan to declare Rwanda a “safe” destination for deported asylum seekers passed into law Thursday after King Charles III signed the bill, the symbolic end to months of Parliamentary wrangling.
title: Sunak’s Rwanda Migrant Plan Becomes Law After King’s Sign-off

description: Alejandro Cao de Benós has been accused of violating sanctions in connection with a 2019 cryptocurrency conference. “I am not afraid,” he says.
title: How North Korea’s Man in the West Ran Afoul of US Authorities

description: Support among swing-state voters for US aid to Israel has plunged in the months since the country launched its campaign to root out Hamas in the Gaza Strip, according to the latest Bloomberg News/Morning Consult poll.
title: Support for US Aid to Israel Plummets Among Swing-State Voters

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Israel’s Plan for Rafah Attack Raises Pressure on Netanyahu

description: French President Emmanuel Macron said Europe can no longer rely on the US for its security needs and must build its own credible defense.
title: Macron Says EU Can No Longer Rely on US for Its Security

description: The Scottish National Party ended its power-sharing deal with the Greens and will run Scotland as a minority government, preempting a breakup that will add to a sense that the pro-independence bloc’s grip over politics in Edinburgh is slipping.
title: SNP to Run Scotland as Minority in Latest Setback for Party

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will visit Hungary from May 8 to 10 as part of a trip to Europe, Cabinet Minister Gergely Gulyas said at a briefing on Thursday.
title: Chinese President Xi to Visit Hungary on May 8-10, Minister Says

description: Abu Dhabi-based G42 found it could no longer play for both teams.
title: Caught Between the US and China, a Powerful AI Upstart Chooses Sides

description: The Pentagon’s top weapons tester recused himself from from decisions or program evaluations involving No. 1 defense contractor Lockheed Martin Corp., in a case that may only add to scrutiny of the revolving door between the military and its suppliers.
title: Pentagon’s Top Tester to Abstain From Assessing Lockheed Weapons

description: The Biden administration called on China to improve its protections of intellectual property, saying that the pace of Beijing’s reforms remains too slow.
title: US Says China Moving Too Slowly on Protecting Intellectual Property

description: Close advisers to the leading candidates in Mexico’s presidential race agreed that the country should diversify its global trade links and ensure that it capitalizes on efforts by companies looking to relocate supply chains to North America — including from China.
title: Mexico Should Diversify Trade Ties, Top Candidates’ Aides Agree

description: Taiwan’s incoming president warned his government faces a grim international environment as he finalized his cabinet line-up by appointing key defense and foreign-affairs officials.
title: Taiwan’s Lai Warns of ‘Severe’ Challenges for New Security Team

description: The MP, who died this week, demonstrated that it’s possible to keep your moral compass in politics.
title: Frank Field Showed How Politicians Ought to Contribute

description: Emmanuel Macron wants to set the stage for more robust European defense and drive support for Kyiv, yet he faces a battle to get results or convince voters at home to back him.
title: Macron Struggles to Deliver His Vision for a Stronger Europe

description: Five teenagers linked to the stabbing of a Sydney bishop have been charged following raids by the city’s counterterrorism team, with investigations ongoing.
title: Five Teens Linked to Sydney Bishop Stabbing Charged After Raids

description: Columbia University’s governing body backed President Nemat Shafik amid escalating demands for her resignation, spurred by student-led protests over the Israel-Hamas conflict.
title: Columbia Defies Call for President’s Ouster After Arrests, Protests

description: Republican nominee Donald Trump and his campaign will host a donor retreat next week in Palm Beach, Florida, with some prominent Republicans who have been discussed as his potential running mate.
title: Trump to Convene Donors, Vice President Hopefuls in Palm Beach
